strings.Value: "Professor Eobald, is this true?"
"What do you have to say for yourself, Alondi?"
"What do you want to do with him, Linzi?"
"Forgive him. Give him the chance to atone for his deeds."
"You don't have to forgive him. It doesn't matter how wonderful his poetry is, I don't need people like him in my {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom}."
[Attack Alondi] "Did you have fun bullying Linzi? It's my turn to have some fun now!"
"It's your decision, Linzi."
"Look who's here! Linzi! And is this {mf|His|Her} {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}? Praise all the good gods — you made it just in time! A bit longer, and we'd have been done for!"
"Hail, {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}! Now we all-" {n}Alondi stops when he sees Linzi's piercing glare.{/n} "Is... is something wrong?"

"You don't even remember, do you? Of course you don't. But I'll never forget — you and your friends poisoned the years I spent at the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}! Hiding my things, tearing my books, spilling ink on me, dunking me in the fountain... And now you have the nerve to come here? Maybe you want a job at the publishing house, too?"

"I... Of course, I would never dare accuse our dear Linzi of lying, but I know nothing of these accusations. Alondi has always put his best foot forward with me. He's a wonderful poet and musician, and he's always been polite... If not for him risking his life to get us to the capital, we'd all be dead!"
"Alondi, did you really treat a peer this way? For shame. I thought better of you!"

"What is there to say? We were students — sometimes we made jokes, pulled pranks. Sometimes they were rude and stupid. I'm sorry, Linzi. I'm ashamed of my behavior — I never should have done those things to you."
"You can shove your apologies all the way..." {n}You hear tears in Linzi's voice.{/n}
"Please, Linzi... We are at your mercy. Will you truly stoop to revenge? Is this what you took from my lessons?"

"I don't know! I'm sorry, Teacher, but I can't bear to look at him. Let him go wherever he wants — {g|Restov}Restov{/g}, {g|Mivon}Mivon{/g}, or {g|Absalom}Absalom{/g} for all I care. I'll even give him money for travel, just so I don't have to see his face!"

"Linzi..." {n}Eobald clasps his hands before him.{/n} "I understand that you're hurt. And I'm at fault, too. If the other teachers and I had paid as much attention to the students' behavior as we did to their grades..." {n}Eobald closes his eyes and takes a deep breath.{/n} "I cannot change the past, but please find it in your heart to forgive Alondi. He's an exceptional poet — allow him to atone for his behavior, bring a little kindness and light to your {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom}."
"I... Teacher, I don't know." {n}Linzi looks back at you.{/n} "What should I do? Maybe I should forgive him? Let him write those brilliant verses of his... The scumbag!"
"Wait! No! Don't!" {n}Linzi grabs your hand. Alondi, face pale from terror, runs away as fast as he can.{/n}
{n}Linzi glares at Alondi for a long while, then sighs and looks away.{/n} "Fine. Stay. But you'd better write the best poetry in the world! Got it? I'll be checking!"
{n}Linzi points toward the woods.{/n} "Get lost. I don't care about your poetry — I can't forget how you tore up mine."
"I promise!"
{n}Alondi lowers his head.{/n} "As you say. But I truly am sorry."

{n}Everyone is silent for a while as they look at each other awkwardly. Eobald is the first to break the silence.{/n} "I... see Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness} prefers a... resolute manner of administration!"
"Thank you. I swear, you won't regret it."
"Well, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}, Linzi... You are well within your rights."

"Teacher... I'm so glad to see you! I can't believe that talentless hack Irovetti kicked you out of the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}. I wish everyone could see what a 'philanthropist and patron of the arts' he really is! His tricks could make up a whole book!"

"You know, Linzi, that's not a bad idea! I know many... details of just how much harm the king brought upon his own {g|Academy of Grand Arts}academy{/g}. If you find yourself with time between adventures, I would be happy to sit down and write such a book with you! All the more so now that you have your own printing house to print it!"
"Seriously? You... you want to work on a book with me? Of course I'll find the time! Let's set off for the capital as soon as possible — I can't wait to get started!"
"Let's get back to the capital. I can't wait to start working on the book, Teacher!"

"I must say, your books have been very successful! And starting your own publishing house with the printing of a book {d|Linzi Forbidden}banned{/d} by Irovetti's personal order — well, that was a bold move. I'm so proud of you!"

"Oh, and please allow me to congratulate you, albeit late, for the opening of your own publishing house. I had the pleasure of reading those of your books that managed to reach {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}, and I must say, you certainly studied well — your choice of authors and books for publication suggests a {d|Linzi Beauty}sophisticated taste{/d} in literature!"

"Not to change the subject, but I've looked through some of the books you've {d|Linzi Pulp Fiction}printed{/d}. I admit the books weren't quite to my taste, but the students seem to love them. I'm glad you're finally realizing your dream of running your own publishing house!"

"Listen, pipsqueak... Advice is usually cheap, but this one's paid for off the hide of my back. Don't forgive him — people don't change. He was shit, and he'll stay shit, whether you give him one chance or a hundred!"
"Does Shelyn herself not teach that one should not deny mercy to those who ask for it?"
